How to Install ferret-datasets on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • ferret-datasets

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install ferret-datasets on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing ferret-datasets on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall ferret-datasets in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install ferret-datasets, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install ferret-datasets Using apt

To install ferret-datasets in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install ferret-datasets using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install ferret-datasets

The installation of ferret-datasets might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install ferret-datasets Using apt-get

To install ferret-datasets using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install ferret-datasets.

sudo apt-get -y install ferret-datasets

Install ferret-datasets Using Synaptic

To install ferret-datasets using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install ferret-datasets on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for ferret-datasets. This will display the ferret-datasets package in the package window, now to install ferret-datasets, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the ferret-datasets package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of ferret-datasets.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install ferret-datasets Using aptitude

To install ferret-datasets on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of ferret-datasets.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install ferret-datasets using the command aptitude install ferret-datasets.

sudo aptitude -y install ferret-datasets

How to Upgrade ferret-datasets on debian

If you want to upgrade the ferret-datasets package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade ferret-datasets using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade ferret-datasets to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade ferret-datasets.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade ferret-datasets sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade ferret-datasets

Upgrade ferret-datasets using Aptitude

To upgrade ferret-datasets using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade ferret-datasets.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade ferret-datasets

Upgrade ferret-datasets using Synaptic

To upgrade ferret-datasets using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for ferret-datasets, now right-click ferret-datasets, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade ferret-datasets just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall ferret-datasets on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall ferret-datasets from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just ferret-datasets, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove ferret-datasets

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of ferret-datasets

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of ferret-datasets you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge ferret-datasets

Remove ferret-datasets using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall ferret-datasets using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for ferret-datasets, right-click the ferret-datasets package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall ferret-datasets click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install ferret-datasets on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade ferret-datasets using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of ferret-datasets then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
